content:
I'm trying to get the value of the multi-nested configuration value. The problem is when I read the whole config file first with 

$views_members = config('views.view.members');

and then try to get to the value of specific configuration setting with 

$views_members->get(['display']['page']['display_options']['fields']['picture']));

it never works. How do you, guys, get to the multilevel configuration?

To be honest, I never tried to deal with a view by config file. Rather than parsing the file, I'd load the view (as object) and handle things with its methods. But maybe that's not possible in your use-case?

docwilmot said:

$views_members->get('display.page.display_options.fields.picture');?

Works like a charm! Thank you!

indigoxela said:

To be honest, I never tried to deal with a view by config file. Rather than parsing the file, I'd load the view (as object) and handle things with its methods. But maybe that's not possible in your use-case?

Yea, I needed to manipulate with the configuration value, not only reading, but also setting. So the way @docwilmot pointed works perfectly.

Yep, config files use . to separate nested levels.

The config option may contain periods to indicate levels within the config file.

https://docs.backdropcms.org/api/backdrop/core%21includes%21config.inc/function/config_get/1
